summary: This is an FBI daily briefing document from November 12, 2020, covering a wide range of news topics including criminal investigations, counter-terrorism, counter-intelligence, and other FBI-related activities. It includes a brief mention that plaintiffs in the Epstein case missed deadlines for keeping testimony secret, but the document is primarily a news digest covering various national security and law enforcement matters.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Mentioned in context of a civil lawsuit where plaintiffs missed deadlines to keep testimony secret.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Named as defendant in civil lawsuit with Epstein accuser Virginia Roberts Giuffre.

persons.name: Virginia Roberts Giuffre
persons.context: Plaintiff in civil lawsuit against Ghislaine Maxwell.

persons.name: Loretta Preska
persons.context: Presiding over the civil case between Ghislaine Maxwell and Virginia Roberts Giuffre.

connections.description: Maxwell is described as Epstein's accused co-conspirator in the civil lawsuit.
Maxwell and Giuffre are parties in a civil lawsuit that has now been settled.

events.title: Deadline for opposing document release
events.description: Deadline passed for non-parties to oppose the way their names would be redacted in Epstein case documents.

events.title: Filing regarding document release
events.description: Giuffre's lawyers filed notice that no opposition came in against the release of documents as proposed in the Epstein case.

keyFacts: Plaintiffs in the Epstein case missed deadlines for keeping testimony secret.
Two non-parties in the civil dispute between Ghislaine Maxwell and Virginia Roberts Giuffre had until November 5 to oppose how their names would be redacted.
No opposition was filed against the release of documents as proposed, making the release of more documents imminent.
The civil dispute between Maxwell and Giuffre has been settled.
The document is primarily an FBI news briefing covering various topics with only brief mention of the Epstein case.
